byline.original: By RANDY KENNEDY and HILARIE M. SHEETS

abstract: Inside Art column; Sotheby’s will auction Robert Mapplethorpe’s sexually-graphic photo Man in Polyester Suit, provocative image that spurred debates in 1980 over free expression and public spending on art, and estimates its worth at $250,000-$350,000; Madison Square Park plans May 2016 display of Martin Puryear sculpture Big Bling.
lead_paragraph: A print of “Man in Polyester Suit,” a tightly cropped picture of a black man in a suit with his penis hanging out, is to be auctioned by Sotheby’s.

headline.main: Mapplethorpe Print at Center of Culture Wars Returns to Public Eye
headline.print_headline: Mapplethorpe Print at Center of Culture Wars Returns to Public Eye

snippet: A print of “Man in Polyester Suit,” a tightly cropped picture of a black man in a suit with his penis hanging out, is to be auctioned by Sotheby’s.
